markdown.markdown:
* I took a walk to a great green park * Where stones lie dormant, and giants praise the sky. * There I saw your mother, and she asked me, * What have you witnessed today? * Was it the color of my children or the echoes of the winged? * Was it another one of your kind, discovering for the first time * the sweet nectar of solitude? * Was it the land giving everything away, asking * for nothing in return? *   * I came seeking meaning but left with so much more. * She brought me to you, to the grass and the sun, * To the roots I daily stand upon. * The flowers sprang forth with their inviting arms * and asked me, their newcomer, to stay while. *   * Listen, they whispered. * Thereâ€™s something you need to hear.
